reviews.text: Our stay was perfect and the hotel was delightful. The location is central to Galleries Lafayette and O'pera. The hotel is within walking distance from the CDG - O'pera, Roissy Bus 8.50e o/w

We stayed in room 521 which was close to the elevator. The room consisted of a king size bed, writing desk and chair, internet, in-room safe, tv, mini bar, coffee maker, trouser press and a full bath w/ hair dryer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading some mixed reviews, I was a little worried about this hotel. However, I was more than pleasantly surprised. The location is great...within walking distance to many things, including Galleries Lafayette, a wonderful department store. Lobby is lovely, elevators were charming. Our room was small but lovely with a beautiful chandelier.The bathroom was charming and immaculate, and our french window opened onto Boulevard Housmann and with the little wrought iron scrollwork, was delightfully, typically Parisienne. I was extremely happy with this hotel and would definitely go back.

reviews.text: For the money this is a very ordinary hotel. The rooms are tiny (and we stayed in a club room). The rooms are also very tired and the bathrooms are particuarly poor. The service lacks warmth and can be slow and rude at times. Overall this hotel lacks quality and friendliness. I would advise people to look for better value elsewhere.
reviews.title: Could have been better for a four star

reviews.text: Accommodation in Paris is known for being cramped, expensive and often dated, so when my mother-in-law booked us all on a trip to Paris, I was a little apprehensive. I read the reviews for this hotel after she had booked it and was even more apprehensive. However, we were in a club room on the 7th floor and had some views. Shame we couldn't open the window more than an inch, it would have been nice to be able to lean out of the window and take in the views properly. The staff were good I thought for Parisian standards - usually stuck-up and extremely uninterested in helping non-french speaking people. It was however, the location of this hotel that made our 4 days in Paris so much easier. Personally I would have preferred to stay in Marais or similar, surrounded by cute shops and in the buzz of it, but if you're going to do the standard sights, then this is ideal. The metro station is literally outside the front door of the hotel. And it is dead centre between all the various sights.
reviews.title: Expensive for what you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Millennium Opera as part of a booking made with Lastminute, with flights from London Heathrow included in the cost. We caught the train in from CDG and walked down r. La Fayette to the hotel - this took about 20 minutes; alternatives include taking the metro, but the walk was pleasant and downhill.

reviews.text: The hotel itself is a lovely old building with many intact art deco features. We had a standard room on the 6th floor overlooking the side street; very quiet despite being in the centre of Paris.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Our room was lovely; a comfortable king size bed, huge wardrobe and clean art-deco bathroom; plenty of hot water and exactly what we were hoping for. A minor criticism would be that the blanket on the bed was a little worn and tired (with what looked like cigarette burns in a couple of places).
